title: SpaceX launches 21 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 return to flight mission
summary: The mission was scheduled to launch less than an hour before a Starlink flight from Vandenberg Space Force Base. Liftoff happened at 3:43 a.m. EDT (0743 UTC).

title: SpaceX set a launch turnaround record with back-to-back, coast-to-coast Falcon 9 launches
summary: The mission is the first for SpaceX since a landing mishap caused it to lose its most flown Falcon 9 booster. Liftoff is set for 1:48 a.m. PDT (4:48 a.m. EDT, 0848 UTC).

title: SpaceX Falcon 9 regains flight approval operations from FAA
summary: In a quick turnaround, SpaceX’s Falcon 9 booster has regained flight approval operations from the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). The FAA revoked...

title: Hague, Gorbunov Get To Stay on Crew-9
summary: NASA announced today that NASA astronaut Nick Hague and Roscosmos cosmonaut Aleksandr Gorbunov will be the two Crew-9 members who get to remain on the September mission to the International […]

title: General Dynamics secures $491 million contract extension from Space Development Agency
summary: The new contract nearly doubles General Dynamics' agreement for satellite ground systems to nearly $900 million through 2029

title: ABL Space Systems lays off staff
summary: Launch vehicle developer ABL Space Systems has laid off a significant portion of its workforce, citing the need to reduce costs after the loss of a rocket in a static-fire test.

title: Real estate investor moves to ease Space Coast strain
summary: Real estate investor Hines plans to start building a large industrial complex on Florida’s Space Coast this year to help ease strained infrastructure at the world’s busiest launch hub.

title: Space startup ThinkOrbital taps retired general John Shaw as advisor
summary: Shaw was most recently deputy commander of U.S. Space Command

title: NASA bumps two astronauts from SpaceX flight to make room for Starliner crew
summary: NASA has bumped two female astronauts. including the commander, from the next SpaceX crew rotation flight to the international space station, freeing up two seats to give the agency's Starliner astronauts a ride home next February.

title: NASA makes a very tough decision in setting final Crew-9 assignments
summary: "I am deeply proud of our entire crew."
